alert.note: Alert for Alexander; Caldwell (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 15 at 9:53PM EDT until July 16 at 12:00AM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: The National Weather Service in Greenville-Spartanburg has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Western Alexander County in the piedmont of North Carolina... Eastern Caldwell County in western North Carolina... * Until midnight EDT. * At 953 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 3 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar and gages. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Lenoir, Sawmills, Granite Falls, Gamewell, Bethlehem, Hudson, Cajah`s Mountain, Cedar Rock, Lake Rhodhiss, Lake Hickory, Kings Creek, Little River In Alexander County, Northlakes, Patterson and Ellendale. Watch for flooded roads around greater Lenoir and along the Highway 321 corridor from Patterson to the Catawba River. Streams are expected to flood low lying areas, especially tributaries of the Little River and Lower Creek. Rising river levels along the Upper Yadkin are expected as well. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
